intro: Banksia haematostachya, commonly known as the red-stemmed banksia, is a shrub native to southwestern Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive red or orange stems and its dense, cylindrical spikes of yellow flowers. The plant produces woody follicles that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and dry forests. Banksia haematostachya is an important component of the local flora and provides habitat for various native wildlife species.
